title: "eds212-day2-comp1"

## Derivatives in R

Here are my notes!


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
fx <- expression(3.1 * (x ^ 4) - 28 * x)

# This is storing the derivative expression
df_dx <- D(fx, 'x')

# This calls it back (show me!)
df_dx
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
3.1 * (4 * x^3) - 28
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
x <- 10

eval(df_dx) # Evaluates derivative
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 12372
```
:::
:::


You try! Find the slope of g(z) = 2z^3^ - 10.5z^2^ + 4.1 at z = 3.6


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
gt = expression(2 * z ^ 3 - 10.5 * z ^ 2 + 4.1)

dg_dt = D(gt, 'z')

z = seq(from = 1, to = 3, length = 20)

eval(dg_dt)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
 [1] -15.00000 -15.88089 -16.62881 -17.24377 -17.72576 -18.07479 -18.29086
 [8] -18.37396 -18.32410 -18.14127 -17.82548 -17.37673 -16.79501 -16.08033
[15] -15.23269 -14.25208 -13.13850 -11.89197 -10.51247  -9.00000
```
:::
:::
